questions.question_text:
A Billing Specialist has created and completed an invoice for $100 USD for Customer A. The Specialist prints the invoice and realizes that the invoice should have been created for Customer B. The accounting for the transaction for Customer A is posted to the General Ledger.
How can this be corrected?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D. 

Reason: There is a credit transaction link once navigated to the transaction where you would credit the entire amount for that invoice. Once completed you would create a new invoice.

I believe the answer isn't B as an on-account credit memo is a standalone transaction and it doesn't mention that this is then applied to the original invoice. It is assumed that the Billing Specialist applies the credit memo to the invoice but it isn't stated.

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer
B. Credit the Original Invoice and create a new Invoice.

choices.B: Create an on-account credit memo for $100 USD for the invoice and enter a new invoice for Customer B.
choices.A: Create an adjustment for the entire amount and create a negative adjustment for Customer B.
choices.D: Navigate to the credit transaction link in the Billing work area, credit the entire amount, and enter a new invoice for Customer B.
choices.C: Change the status of the invoice to Incomplete and enter a new invoice for Customer B.

How can I assign a strategy to a customer?
Strategies are assigned automatically when the Strategy Management program is executed. However you can manually change a customers strategy in the sub tab Strategy associated to the Profile tab. In addition, you can add, remove, and reassign tasks associated to the strategy.
